title.narrative: Peru Implementation Phase of Peru´s National Eco-Efficiency Strategy

description.narrative: Peru’s economic growth over the past decade has put the country on a solid path to OECD membership. The institutional and economic reforms it has undertaken lead to the improved competitiveness of its economy. In this way, Peru seeks to improve its standing on the World Bank Doing Business Index as a sign of aggregate improvement from internal multisectoral reforms. To this end Peru developed the Competitiveness Agenda 2014-2018, which sets national goals to accelerate the implementation of reforms. One of these goals concerns improved management of natural resources and the need to implement eco-efficient practices in public institutions. To achieve these objective, Peru will need to: Improve the current EcoIP program, which seeks to train 16 priority public institutions in efficient resource management; and implify and institutionalize the reporting process to the Ministry of Environment so that 30% of public institutions at the national and subnational levels report their use of natural resources.
Support Peru implement the National Eco-efficiency Strategy. Assist public sector improve its eco-efficient performance in relation to the sustainable use of the natural resources.

description.narrative: The support provided by GGGI during 2017 was about reorganizing and strengthening the structure of EcoIP 2017 program in order to replicate the initiative the following year. The documents prepared by GGGI were about the compilation of lessons learned and the systematization of EcoIP 2017, and the work breakdown structure for MINAM´s ecoefficiency team. This systematization of experiences to support an improved EcoIP program also helped increase the number of institutions and institutional processes articulated to ecoefficiency.

description.narrative: The support provided by GGGI during 2018 was not only linked to the development of the pilot at subnational level in the San Martin region, but also continued advising on the development of EcoIP at national level which was divided into two major tasks: Following up with institutions that implemented eco-efficiency measures during 2017, and replicating EcoIP 2017 with new institutions. The activities developed in 2018 can be summarized into the following items: (1) Support socialization and launching of 6 public institutions at sub national level (2) Develop inputs for roles and responsibilities within the Ecoefficiency team of the Ministry of Environment (3) Compilation and analysis of lessons learned (4) Development of national and sub national level ecoefficiency management implementation upscaling proposal

title.narrative: List of regional entities ready to install an eco-efficiency plan
Peruvian government has increased number of public institutions accurately reporting ecoefficiency performance and effectively employing ecoefficient and energy efficient practices

description.narrative: Through GGGI support for the national-level improvement of the EcoIP public institution training program, the expansion of the program to a pilot region at the subnational level, and support for the digital reporting system, GGGI assisted the Peruvian government to increase the number of participant institutions from 16 (2017) to 41 (2018), thus surpassing the target of 33 institutions involved in ecoefficiency reporting.
